title: Justin Timberlake says Lizzo 'thought he was lying' about epic collab
text:
We’re so ready for a collab (Pictures: Getty)

Justin Timberlake and Lizzo fans were over the moon at the prospect of an epic collab from the pair but apparently even they weren’t sure it was going to happen.

It turns out Lizzo thought JT was lying about the whole thing.

The pair met at the Songwriters Hall of Fame ceremony in June, with the SexyBack hitmaker confessing he was a big fan of the star and would love to write with her.

‘I was like, ‘”I’m such a fan if you ever want to write,” and she thought I was lying,’ he recalled.

‘And we got in and we got a couple of ideas – I don’t know when they’re gonna come out but they’re pretty good.’

The 38-year-old added to Entertainment Tonight about the Truth Hurts singer: ‘To be honest, I just called my publishers and I said, “You know, I just want to work with young, fresh people and I want to collaborate more.”‘

Justin and Lizzo first sent fans wild when they shared videos of themselves in the studio together.

‘Lizzo flames, brb,’ he wrote.

Meanwhile, Lizzo also posted the video on her Instagram Stories, captioning it: ‘Did some rap s*** wiff JT.’

So casual.

She’s in high demand (Picture: Getty Images)

The star, who recently broke the record for the longest-running #1 single by a solo female rapper, is no stranger to a cheeky collab after she enlisted K-Pop band AB6IX for her Truth Hurts remix.

And it seems she’s in high demand after Rihanna admitted she’s also up for a collab.

Speaking to Entertainment Tonight, RiRi said: ‘Gosh I love Lizzo. I would collaborate with her on the lights for this interview right now, like Lizzo is so badass.’

The singer-turned-businesswomen said Lizzo represents ‘everything’ that Savage stands for.

‘A confident woman, no matter what size, colour, shape. Your attitude is what makes you savage,’ she said during her Savage X Fenty fashion show back in September.

‘It’s the confidence that you have in yourself and it’s the confidence that you can give off to people who look like you and feel like you and those are the people that identify with the brand.’

We’ll be needing this collab immediately, please and thank you.
